messages.subject: Re: The Good Earth
messages.msgSnippet: Oh, I m sorry! We had three Good Earth restaurants here at one time--now ... of them! ... the Tito ... basque sauce, ... I used to work at a Good Earth
messages.messageBody:
<<<<> Oh, I'm sorry! We had three Good Earth restaurants here
at one time--now
> we're down to two--and our eating-out life revolves around one
of them!
> I always ( 95% of the time) order a vegetarian tostado (usually
the Tito
> Burrito, kids' version), which comes with a lovely Spanish
basque sauce,
> sour cream and guac. Makes me drool to think of it.
>
> Susan>>>>


I used to work at a Good Earth restaurant (when I was a mere 18
years old <g>). I never got tired of eating the food. I don't
understand why so many of them are closing. You would think
that the healthy eaters and vegetarians would keep them going.
What a shame, sigh.

Meghan

messages.subject: The Good Earth
messages.msgSnippet: On Wednesday, May 22, 2002, at 02:32 PM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com ... Oh, I m sorry! We had three Good Earth restaurants here at one time--now we re down
messages.messageBody:
On Wednesday, May 22, 2002, at 02:32 PM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
wrote:

> The Good Earth is gone! *sob* They had some of the best food I've ever
> eaten and I miss them.

Oh, I'm sorry! We had three Good Earth restaurants here at one time--now
we're down to two--and our eating-out life revolves around one of them!
I always ( 95% of the time) order a vegetarian tostado (usually the Tito
Burrito, kids' version), which comes with a lovely Spanish basque sauce,
sour cream and guac. Makes me drool to think of it.

Susan
